Recipe.Description: Bright green buttery cabbage and your kitchen doesn't smell like a Russian prison kitchen.

Prerequisites.Prerequisite: Setup to blanch and shock: Set a large pot of water boiling and fill large bowl with iced water.

Method.Step: Melt butter in a large skillet, add mustard and caraways seeds, cook until butter just begins to brown, add croutons, toss and remove from heat.

Add shredded cabbage in small batches to boiling water, never so much that the water stops boiling, cook until color turns bright green, but no more than a couple of minutes (if you SMELL cooked cabbage, you cooked it too long), remove cabbage from pot, plunge into ice water. Repeat until all cabbage is cooked.
Drain the ice water, try to get the cabbage as dry as possible.
Add cabbage to skillet with butter and crouton sauce. Toss over medium heat until hot enough to serve.
